title: CSS Advanced Styling Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of CSS Variables, calc(), clamp(), and modern CSS functions

questions.question: How do you reference a CSS variable?
questions.explanation: color: var(--primary-color); — var() retrieves the value of a CSS variable.

questions.question: What does calc() allow you to do?
choices: Combine different units in one calculation
Clamp values between min and max
questions.explanation: Combine different units in one calculation — e.g., calc(100% - 40px).

questions.question: What is the purpose of clamp()?
choices: Constrain a value between a minimum and maximum while still scaling
questions.explanation: Constrain a value between a minimum and maximum while still scaling — Useful for responsive typography or widths.

questions.question: How do you apply a dark theme using CSS variables?
choices: Override the variables in a parent class (like .dark)
questions.explanation: Override the variables in a parent class (like .dark) — Updates all elements using those variables.

questions.question: Why use CSS variables for theme switching?
choices: It allows updating multiple styles dynamically in one place
To make the site load faster
questions.explanation: It allows updating multiple styles dynamically in one place — Makes themes maintainable and scalable.
